wikipedia_page.main: Maurice Arnold de Forest  (9 January 1879 – 6 October 1968) was an early motor racing driver, aviator and Liberal politician in the United Kingdom.

response: In 1872, it became the property of baron Maurice de Hirsch, who fully restored it. Although having a town house in rue de l'Élysée in Paris, he and his family frequently stayed at Beauregard. At his death in 1896, the château was bequeathed to Maurice Arnold de Forest, comte de Bendern (Liechtenstein title). He owned several properties across Europe and did not come often to Beauregard, leaving the château abandoned.
**** adopted Maurice Arnold de Forest-Bischoffsheim (1879–1968), English aviator, politician
